alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 8:52PM MST until January 02 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SUNDAY TO 5 AM MST MONDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Moderate snow amounts expected above 6000 feet, with lighter amounts down to 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches, with the highest amounts above 6500 feet. Winds gusting 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near the Grand Canyon, North Rim, Prescott, Valle, Walker, Mingus Mountain including Highway 89A. * WHEN...From 5 AM Sunday to 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel. Snow forecast from 5 AM Sunday to 5 AM Monday: Grand Canyon 3 to 5 inches North Rim 9 to 13 inches Prescott 1 to 2 inches Valle 1 to 3 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Yavapai County Mountains
